name: Battler (Creeepling)
description:
Battler is a bite-sized PvP game, inspired by Pokemon, Final Fantasy, and World of Warcraft. It's currently available for PC only.

A Warrior and a Priest facing two Warriors. Yeah, these sprites are as temporary as they get.

Choose your character(or characterS) and enter a deathmatch! You will have to juggle defending yourself from enemy blows, and trying to set up a strong damaging turn. All in a tiny tactical setup, with no movement mechanic involved!

There are two classes to choose from, with more coming really soon. You can control up to three characters at once. That's not a technical limitation, but I've done a couple 3v3s against myself while fixing bugs, and my head started to hurt really quickly.

Two AI teams dishing out some pain to each other. Honestly, after adding AI yesterday I have been spending too much time watching it fight itself.

The game's main focus is Multiplayer. It is fully functional, however, in this early stage of development, there's a prerequisite: you need to be logged into Steam, and you need to add Wienne to your Steam library(it's a free game). That is because I am currently using my previous game's ID to host multiplayer games. It is a temporary thing.

Invite your friends over for a battle, or test your mettle against the AI! It's not extremely smart yet, but it sometimes beats me :(

Istra is asking for help as she is about to get demolished by 3 green-haired Warriors.

As of 2/11/2011, this project is about 3 weeks old. So be kind to my little baby!

All feedback is appreciated. More to come soon!
